headline: NFL Stats: Who's the oldest active NFL player in 2022?
sentences: The oldest player in the NFL was Tom Brady at 44 years of age, but after announcing his retirement, the Los Angeles Rams' offensive tackle, Andrew Whitworth, 40, took his place.
Adam Vinatieri, 48, was the oldest active NFL player before retiring on May 26 after 24 seasons as a kicker with the New England Patriots and Indianapolis Colts.
George Blanda is the oldest player in NFL history to take the field, retiring at 48-years-old in 1975 after 26 seasons as a quarterback and placekicker.
The 40-year-old Whitworth is older than his coach, Sean McVay, 36, who just became the youngest head coach in NFL history to win a Super Bowl.
Whitworth, who just won his first Super Bowl since getting drafted in 2006 by the Cincinnati Bengals, has been with the Rams since 2017.
Other veteran players include kicker Robbie Gould, punter Sam Koch, punter Andy Lee, and punter Dustin Colquitt, all 39 years of age.
The Chicago Bears' offensive tackle, Jason Peters, who turned 40 on January 22, is the only other active NFL player in his forties.
Ryan Fitzpatrick, 39, of the Washington Commanders is the oldest quarterback in the league since Ben Roethlisberger retired.
Big Ben turns 40 on March 2, but decided to hang up his helmet after 18 seasons with the Pittsburgh Steelers.
Currently, Aaron Rodgers is the second-oldest QB in the league at 38 years of age.
He has the sixth-most starts of any offensive lineman in NFL history at 235.
Who is the oldest player in NFL history?
